statements: SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions;
SELECT progression_id, chord_progression FROM ChordProgressions ORDER BY progression_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions WHERE emotion = 'Happy';
SELECT chord_progression, emotion FROM ChordProgressions WHERE progression_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions ORDER BY emotion ASC, progression_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions WHERE emotion = 'happy' ORDER BY progression_id DESC;
SELECT chord_progression, emotion FROM ChordProgressions WHERE chord_progression LIKE 'A%';
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_progressions, emotion FROM ChordProgressions GROUP BY emotion;
SELECT DISTINCT emotion FROM ChordProgressions ORDER BY emotion ASC, progression_id ASC LIMIT 3;
SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions WHERE emotion IN ('sad', 'melancholic') AND chord_progression ILIKE '%minor%' ORDER BY progression_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions;
SELECT name, chords FROM ChordProgressions WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, name FROM ChordProgressions ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT * FROM EmotionalEffects WHERE intensity > 5;
SELECT DISTINCT effect FROM EmotionalEffects;
SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, chords FROM ChordProgressions WHERE name LIKE '%major%' ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT e.effect, c.name FROM EmotionalEffects e INNER JOIN ChordProgressions c ON e.progression_id = c.id;
SELECT c.name, COUNT(e.id) AS effect_count FROM ChordProgressions c LEFT JOIN EmotionalEffects e ON c.id = e.progression_id GROUP BY c.name HAVING COUNT(e.id) > 5;
SELECT * FROM ChordProgressions WHERE chords @> ARRAY['C', 'F', 'G'];
SELECT * FROM chord_progressions WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, progression FROM chord_progressions ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT effect_name FROM emotional_effects WHERE id in (1, 3, 5);
SELECT * FROM progressions_effects WHERE progression_id = 2;
SELECT name, effect_name FROM chord_progressions INNER JOIN progressions_effects ON chord_progressions.id = progressions_effects.progression_id ORDER BY effect_name ASC;
SELECT id, name FROM chord_progressions WHERE id = 1
SELECT * FROM emotional_effects WHERE id > 5 ORDER BY effect_name ASC

SELECT cp.name, ee.effect_name FROM chord_progressions cp JOIN progressions_effects pe ON cp.id = pe.progression_id JOIN emotional_effects ee ON pe.effect_id = ee.id WHERE ee.description LIKE '%positive%'

SELECT cp.name, COUNT(ee.id) AS effect_count FROM chord_progressions cp LEFT JOIN progressions_effects pe ON cp.id = pe.progression_id LEFT JOIN emotional_effects ee ON pe.effect_id = ee.id GROUP BY cp.name HAVING effect_count > 2

SELECT cp.name AS progression_name, ee.effect_name AS effect_name FROM chord_progressions cp LEFT JOIN progressions_effects pe ON cp.id = pe.progression_id LEFT JOIN emotional_effects ee ON pe.effect_id = ee.id WHERE cp.id IN (SELECT progression_id FROM progressions_effects WHERE effect_id = 3)
SELECT * FROM Chords;
SELECT chord_name, root_note FROM Chords WHERE musical_key='C#';
SELECT id, chord_type, emotion_effect FROM Chords WHERE chord_type='Major' ORDER BY emotion_effect DESC;
SELECT * FROM Emotions WHERE description IS NOT NULL;
SELECT username, email, registration_date FROM Users ORDER BY registration_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM Chords WHERE root_note = 'A';
SELECT chord_name, emotion_effect FROM Chords WHERE musical_key = 'C Major';
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ChordEmotionMapping WHERE emotion_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM Chords ORDER BY chord_type DESC, root_note ASC;
SELECT c.chord_name, e.emotion_name FROM Chords c JOIN ChordEmotionMapping ce ON c.id = ce.chord_id JOIN Emotions e ON ce.emotion_id = e.id WHERE c.root_note = 'G' AND e.emotion_name = 'Sad';
SELECT * FROM Chords;
SELECT chord_name, chord_type FROM Chords WHERE root_note = 'G';
SELECT chord_name, description FROM Chords ORDER BY chord_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM EmotionalEffects WHERE positive = true AND intensity > 5;
SELECT progression_name, chord_ids FROM Progressions WHERE ARRAY_LENGTH(chord_ids, 1) > 2;
SELECT * FROM Chords WHERE root_note = 'C' OR root_note = 'G' ORDER BY chord_name DESC;
SELECT chord_name, chord_type, description FROM Chords WHERE chord_type = 'Major' ORDER BY chord_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM EmotionalEffects WHERE positive = TRUE AND intensity > 5 ORDER BY effect_name;
SELECT progression_name, chord_ids, description FROM Progressions WHERE ARRAY_LENGTH(chord_ids, 1) > 3 ORDER BY progression_name;

SELECT c.chord_name, p.progression_name, pe.impact FROM Chords c JOIN ChordProgressions cp ON c.chord_id = cp.chord_id JOIN Progressions p ON cp.progression_id = p.progression_id JOIN ProgressionEffects pe ON p.progression_id = pe.progression_id WHERE pe.impact > 0.7 ORDER BY c.chord_name DESC;
